label: CustomerioApi
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Customer.io App API

tools.name: CheckEmailSuppression
tools.description:
Retrieve suppression status and reason for an email.

Use this tool to find out if an email address has been suppressed by the email service provider (ESP) and the reasons for its suppression.

parameters.name: email_to_check_suppression
parameters.description: The email address to check for suppression status and reasons.

tools.name: CreateManualSegment
tools.description:
Create a manual segment with name and description.

Use this tool to create an empty manual segment by specifying its name and description. Ideal for organizing contacts or data into new categories.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"name": "New Marketing Segment", "description": "A segment for targeted marketing campaigns."}

tools.name: CreateNewCollection
tools.description:
Create a new data collection in Customerio.

Use this tool to create a new collection in Customerio by either providing direct data or a URL for downloading CSV or JSON data. Ensure the collection does not exceed 10 MB, and individual rows are under 10 KB.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: CreateWebhook
tools.description:
Create a new webhook configuration for reporting.

Use this tool to set up a new webhook configuration within the Customerio service for reporting purposes.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: DeleteCollection
tools.description:
Delete a collection and its contents.

Use this tool to remove a collection and all its contents from the system. Ensure the collection is not referenced in active campaign messages or broadcasts to avoid disrupting communication.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the collection to be deleted.

tools.name: DeleteManualSegment
tools.description:
Delete a specified manual segment by ID.

Use this tool to delete a specific manual segment in Customerio by providing the segment ID. It's useful for removing outdated or unwanted segments.

parameters.name: segment_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the segment to delete, found under 'Usage' in the Segment page on the dashboard or via the App API.

tools.name: DeleteNewsletter
tools.description:
Delete an individual newsletter and its associated data.

Use this tool to delete a specific newsletter, including its content, settings, and metrics. It will be removed from segments, and its templates will be erased from the Message Library. Additionally, any undelivered in-app messages will be canceled.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the newsletter you want to delete.

tools.name: DeleteReportingWebhook
tools.description:
Delete a reporting webhook's configuration.

Use this tool to remove the configuration of a specific reporting webhook by its ID. Call this when a webhook is no longer needed and should be deleted from the setup.

parameters.name: webhook_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the reporting webhook to be deleted.

tools.name: DownloadExportSignedLink
tools.description:
Retrieve a temporary signed link to download an export.

Use this tool to get a signed link for downloading an export from Customerio. The link is only valid for 15 minutes, so it should be used promptly.

parameters.name: export_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the export you want to access and download. Must be an integer.

tools.name: ExportCustomerData
tools.description:
Export customer data based on specified filters.

Use this tool to export customer data by providing filters and attributes. It returns metadata useful for initiating the data download process.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: ExportDeliveryData
tools.description:
Initiates export of delivery data for newsletters and campaigns.

This tool is used to start an export of delivery data for newsletters, campaigns, or actions based on given filters. Data spans a specified time range, with default and maximum limits. Use it to obtain delivery insights over a specified timeframe.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: FetchMessageDeliveries
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of message deliveries and their metrics.

This tool retrieves a list of message deliveries, including metrics, within a specified time range in your workspace. Use it to analyze message performance over the most recent six months or a defined period. If no specific time range is provided, it defaults to the last six months.

parameters.name: beginning_timestamp
parameters.description: The beginning timestamp in Unix format for your query. Returns deliveries created after this time.

parameters.name: desired_metrics
parameters.description: Specifies the metrics to retrieve. Options include: attempted, sent, delivered, opened, clicked, converted, bounced, spammed, unsubscribed, dropped, failed, undeliverable.

parameters.name: ending_timestamp_for_query
parameters.description: The ending timestamp for your query. If not specified, it defaults to the current time.

parameters.name: filter_by_action_id
parameters.description: Specify the action ID to filter the message deliveries. This narrows the results to messages associated with the given action.

parameters.name: filter_by_campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to filter message deliveries. Use this to retrieve data for a specific campaign only.

parameters.name: filter_by_newsletter_id
parameters.description: An integer representing the ID of the newsletter to filter deliveries for.

parameters.name: item_type_for_metrics
parameters.description: Specify the item type to return metrics for, such as 'email', 'webhook', 'twilio', 'slack', 'push', or 'in_app'. Leave empty for all types.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: The token to fetch the specified page of delivery results.

parameters.name: results_per_page_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of results to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: return_drafts_only
parameters.description: Set to true to return drafts instead of active or sent messages.

tools.name: FilterPeopleInWorkspace
tools.description:
Filter and search for people in your workspace.

    Use this tool to filter people by segment ID and attribute values using complex filters such as `and`, `or`, and `not`. The tool returns arrays of `identifiers` with detailed information and `ids` with only ID values. Suitable for retrieving up to 1000 people per request.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: page_start_token
parameters.description: The token for the page of results to return. Use the 'next' property from responses as this value to access subsequent pages.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: results_per_page_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of people to retrieve per page. Limited to 1000.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: FindSegmentDependencies
tools.description:
Identify campaigns and newsletters using a segment.

This tool identifies which campaigns and newsletters are utilizing a specified segment in Customerio. It should be called when you need to determine the dependencies of a segment within your marketing strategies.

parameters.name: segment_identifier
parameters.description: The ID for a segment, found on its dashboard page or via the App API.

tools.name: FindSuppressedEmailAddresses
tools.description:
Retrieve email addresses suppressed for specific reasons.

Use this tool to identify and retrieve email addresses suppressed by the Email Service Provider for reasons such as bounces, blocks, spam reports, or invalid addresses. Supports pagination for large datasets.

parameters.name: suppression_reason
parameters.description: Specify the reason for email address suppression, such as bounces or spam reports.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of suppression records to retrieve per page, up to 1000.

parameters.name: skip_records
parameters.description: The number of records to skip before retrieving results.

tools.name: FindWorkspaceObjects
tools.description:
Find objects in your workspace using filter conditions.

    This tool is used to find and return a list of object IDs based on specified filter conditions in your Customerio workspace. It allows paging through results and setting limits on the number of objects returned. Useful for locating, creating, or modifying objects based on specific criteria.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: page_start_token
parameters.description: Token for the page of results to return. Use the `next` property from a prior response to continue paging.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: maximum_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve per page.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: GetAllowlistIps
tools.description:
Retrieve IP addresses to allowlist for secure access.

Use this tool to obtain a list of IP addresses that should be allowlisted when configuring firewall settings or using a custom SMTP provider's IP management to deny unknown IPs. This is applicable to all message types and webhooks, except push notifications.

tools.name: GetAllSegments
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of all segments for your account.

Call this tool to get a list of all segments associated with your Customerio account. Use it to fetch and review segment data.

tools.name: GetArchivedMessage
tools.description:
Retrieve an archived copy of a message delivery.

Fetches the archived version of a delivery from Customerio, providing details like the message body, recipient, and associated metrics. Limited to 100 requests per day.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the message to be retrieved.

tools.name: GetBroadcastActionInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific broadcast action.

Call this tool to obtain detailed information about a specific action within a broadcast by providing the broadcast and action IDs.

parameters.name: action_id
parameters.description: The ID of the action to look up or act on within a broadcast.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The numeric identifier of the broadcast to retrieve action details from.

tools.name: GetBroadcastActionLinkMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve link click metrics for a specific broadcast action.

This tool retrieves link click metrics for an individual broadcast action. It provides data for a maximum of 45 days, unless specified otherwise. Use appropriate period and step parameters for custom data ranges.

parameters.name: broadcast_action_id
parameters.description: The ID of the action you want to look up or act on.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the broadcast to retrieve metrics for. It should be an integer value.

parameters.name: item_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of item to return metrics for; options include email, webhook, twilio, slack, push, and in_app. Leave empty for all types.

parameters.name: number_of_periods_to_return
parameters.description: The number of time periods to return metrics for. Defaults to the maximum, or 12 if in months. Max: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, 121 months.

parameters.name: time_period_unit
parameters.description: The unit of time for the report. Acceptable values are 'hours', 'days', 'weeks', or 'months'.

tools.name: GetBroadcastActionMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics for a broadcast action over time steps.

Get metrics for an individual broadcast action, both in total and divided by time steps like days or weeks, over a specified period.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the broadcast you wish to retrieve metrics for.

parameters.name: lookup_action_id
parameters.description: The ID of the action you want to look up or act on. Provide an integer value.

parameters.name: metrics_item_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of item (e.g., email, webhook) to return metrics for. If not provided, metrics for all types are returned.

parameters.name: period_steps
parameters.description: Specify the number of time periods to return metrics for. Defaults to the maximum allowed (24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months) or `12` if the period is in months.

parameters.name: time_unit_for_report
parameters.description: The unit of time for the report, such as hours, days, weeks, or months.

tools.name: GetBroadcastActions
tools.description:
Retrieve actions from a specific broadcast.

Use this tool to get detailed actions that occur as part of a specific broadcast by providing the broadcast ID.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the broadcast to retrieve its actions.

tools.name: GetBroadcastErrors
tools.description:
Retrieve details of broadcast validation errors.

This tool helps identify and understand validation errors in broadcast campaigns, focusing on issues within the broadcast audience and associated elements. Use it to diagnose and resolve broadcast errors.

parameters.name: broadcast_id
parameters.description: The ID of the broadcast to retrieve error information for. Use this to specify which broadcast's errors you want to investigate.

parameters.name: campaign_trigger_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign trigger to return information for. Use this to focus on specific trigger details.

parameters.name: page_start_token
parameters.description: Token to specify which page of results to return. Use the `next` value from responses to navigate pages.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve per page.

tools.name: GetBroadcastLinkMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics for link clicks in a broadcast.

This tool returns metrics for link clicks within a specified broadcast, providing both total counts and series data over defined periods such as days or weeks. Useful for analyzing broadcast performance.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The numeric identifier of the broadcast for which link metrics are needed.

parameters.name: period_steps
parameters.description: Specify the number of time periods to return. Defaults to the maximum or 12 if the period is 'months'. Max: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months.

parameters.name: report_period
parameters.description: Defines the unit of time for the report. Options are 'hours', 'days', 'weeks', or 'months'.

parameters.name: return_unique_customer_results
parameters.description: Set to true to return only unique customer results, ensuring each customer is counted once regardless of clicks.

tools.name: GetBroadcastMessageInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve details about broadcast message deliveries.

This tool returns information about message deliveries from an API-triggered broadcast. Use it to get insights on individual deliveries within a specific time range by providing `start_ts` and `end_ts`. If not specified, data for one month post-trigger is returned. The information reflects when the deliveries were created, with a possible delay to actual send time.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The ID used to identify the specific broadcast to retrieve information about.

parameters.name: beginning_timestamp
parameters.description: The start timestamp for the query, defining the beginning of the time range for message retrieval.

parameters.name: broadcast_state
parameters.description: Specifies the state of a broadcast message. Options are: 'failed', 'sent', 'drafted', or 'attempted'.

parameters.name: ending_timestamp
parameters.description: The endpoint of the time range for the query. It must be an integer representing a timestamp.

parameters.name: item_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of item to return metrics for (e.g., email, webhook). Leave empty for all types.

parameters.name: maximum_results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of message deliveries to retrieve per page. Adjust to control the pagination size for results.

parameters.name: metric_type
parameters.description: Select the metric(s) to be returned. Options include: 'attempted', 'sent', 'delivered', 'opened', 'clicked', 'converted', 'bounced', 'spammed', 'unsubscribed', 'dropped', 'failed', 'undeliverable'.

parameters.name: pagination_start_token
parameters.description: Token for the page of results to return. Use the 'next' property from responses for this value to get the next page.

tools.name: GetBroadcastMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata for a specific broadcast.

Use this tool to get detailed metadata for an individual broadcast based on its unique identifier. Useful for tracking and analyzing individual broadcast details.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a specific broadcast. Use this to retrieve the corresponding metadata.

tools.name: GetBroadcastMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics for a specific broadcast over defined time steps.

This tool retrieves a list of performance metrics for an individual broadcast, broken down into specified time intervals (steps) such as days or weeks. It is useful for analyzing broadcast performance trends. The metrics are returned from the oldest to the newest period.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The unique integer identifier for a specific broadcast.

parameters.name: metric_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of item to return metrics for. Options include 'email', 'webhook', 'twilio', 'slack', 'push', and 'in_app'. Leave empty to get metrics for all types.

parameters.name: number_of_time_periods
parameters.description: The number of time periods to return metrics for. Follow the specific period limits: 24 for hours, 45 for days, 12 for weeks, or 121 for months. Defaults if not specified: to maximum available or 12 for monthly periods. Days start at 00:00 EST, weeks at 00:00 EST on Sunday, and months at 00:00 EST on the 1st.

parameters.name: time_period_unit
parameters.description: Specifies the unit of time for the report, such as hours, days, weeks, or months.

tools.name: GetBroadcastStatus
tools.description:
Retrieve the status of a broadcast using its trigger ID.

Use this tool to get the current status of a broadcast after it has been triggered. Requires the `broadcast_id` and `trigger_id` to fetch the specific status.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the broadcast to retrieve information about. This should be an integer.

parameters.name: campaign_trigger_id
parameters.description: The ID of the specific campaign trigger whose status you want to retrieve.

tools.name: GetBroadcastTranslationInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve translation info for a broadcast message.

Use this tool to get details about a specific translation of a message within a broadcast by providing the `action_id`. Useful for checking how a message is translated into a specific language.

parameters.name: action_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the action you want to lookup or act on. Used to retrieve specific translation details.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a broadcast. Integer type is expected.

parameters.name: language_tag
parameters.description: The language tag for the translation. Use an empty string for the default language.

tools.name: GetBroadcastTriggers
tools.description:
Retrieve triggers for a specific broadcast.

Use this tool to get a list of triggers associated with a particular broadcast in the Customerio service. Useful for understanding the actions set for a broadcast.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of a broadcast to retrieve its triggers. Must be an integer.

tools.name: GetCampaignActionInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve details for a specific action in a campaign.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific action within a marketing campaign. It should be called when you need to understand the specifics of campaign actions such as type, status, or execution details.

parameters.name: action_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the campaign action you want to look up or act on. Provide the integer ID of the action.

parameters.name: campaign_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the campaign for retrieving specific action information.

tools.name: GetCampaignActionLinkMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve link click metrics for a specific campaign action.

This tool retrieves link click metrics for an individual action within a specific campaign. It provides click data for up to 45 days unless specified otherwise and requires at least two steps for any period. Use this tool to analyze link engagement in marketing campaigns.

parameters.name: action_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the action to lookup or perform an operation on in the campaign. It is expected to be an integer.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the campaign to retrieve metrics for. Ensure this is a valid integer.

parameters.name: metric_item_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of item to return metrics for. Acceptable values are 'email', 'webhook', 'twilio', 'slack', 'push', 'in_app'. Leave empty for metrics of all types.

parameters.name: number_of_periods_to_return
parameters.description: Number of periods to return metrics for. Defaults to max available or 12 if in months. Max: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, 121 months.

parameters.name: report_time_unit
parameters.description: The unit of time for the report. Options: hours, days, weeks, or months.

tools.name: GetCampaignActionMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics for a specific campaign action.

Fetch detailed metrics for an individual action within a campaign. Utilizes version 2, allowing for flexible time ranges and resolution-based metrics. Essential for tracking the performance of campaign actions over time.

parameters.name: action_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the specific action to retrieve metrics for within a campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The integer ID of the campaign to retrieve metrics for.

parameters.name: metrics_api_version
parameters.description: Specify the version of the metrics API to use. Recommended to use version '2'.

parameters.name: item_type_for_metrics
parameters.description: Specify the type of item to return metrics for, such as 'email', 'webhook', 'twilio', etc. Leaving it empty returns metrics for all types.

parameters.name: metrics_end_timestamp
parameters.description: The Unix timestamp marking the end of the metrics period. Applicable only for Version 2 and limited to 10 years from the start timestamp.

parameters.name: metrics_resolution
parameters.description: Specifies the increment for metrics in version 2. Options are hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly.

parameters.name: metrics_start_timestamp
parameters.description: Unix timestamp for the start of metrics (Version 2 only).

parameters.name: number_of_steps
parameters.description: For Version 1 only. Specifies the number of time periods to return. Defaults to the maximum, or `12` if in months. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 120 months.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The time zone in region format for the metrics. Default is EST if not specified.

parameters.name: version_1_time_unit
parameters.description: Specifies the time unit for the report in Version 1 (e.g., hours, days, weeks, months).

tools.name: GetCampaignJourneyMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve journey metrics for a specific campaign.

This tool retrieves a list of journey metrics for a specified campaign. It provides insights into how many people triggered the campaign and other related metrics within a specified time period and resolution. Useful for campaign performance analysis.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to return journey metrics for.

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: The Unix timestamp marking the end of the journey metrics report period.

parameters.name: metrics_resolution
parameters.description: Determines the increment for metrics reporting: hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly.

parameters.name: start_timestamp
parameters.description: The UNIX timestamp marking the start of the journey metrics report period.

tools.name: GetCampaignLinkMetrics
tools.description:
Get link click metrics for a campaign over specified periods.

This tool fetches metrics for link clicks within a specified campaign, providing both total and period-specific data (like days or weeks). It's useful for analyzing campaign performance over time.

parameters.name: campaign_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the campaign you want metrics for. Use this ID to specify the target campaign.

parameters.name: count_unique_customers
parameters.description: Set to true to only include unique customer results. Set to false to count all clicks.

parameters.name: number_of_periods
parameters.description: The number of periods to return metrics for. Defaults to the maximum available, or 12 if the period is in months. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months.

parameters.name: report_time_unit
parameters.description: The unit of time for the report. Options are: 'hours', 'days', 'weeks', 'months'.

tools.name: GetCampaignList
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of marketing campaigns.

Use this tool to get a list of your marketing campaigns and their associated metadata. Ideal for reviewing, auditing, or managing your email campaigns.

tools.name: GetCampaignMessages
tools.description:
Retrieve message deliveries from a campaign.

Fetch information on individual message deliveries from a specific campaign over a specified time range. Use parameters like `start_ts` and `end_ts` to refine the data to a specific period.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to fetch message deliveries from.

parameters.name: beginning_timestamp
parameters.description: The starting timestamp for the query to filter messages from a specific time.

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: The ending timestamp for your query to specify the end of the time range for retrieving message deliveries.

parameters.name: message_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of item for metrics (e.g., email, webhook, slack, etc.). Defaults to all types if empty.

parameters.name: metrics_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the metrics you want to retrieve, such as 'sent', 'opened', or 'clicked'.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token indicating the starting point for the page of results to return. Use the `next` property from previous responses.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of results to retrieve per page. It determines the number of message deliveries returned in a single API response.

parameters.name: return_drafts
parameters.description: Set to true to return drafts rather than active/sent messages.

tools.name: GetCampaignMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata for a specific campaign.

Use this tool to get detailed metadata about an individual campaign by specifying the campaign ID.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign for which metadata is requested. Provide a valid integer.

tools.name: GetCampaignMetrics
tools.description:
Fetch metrics for an individual campaign.

Use this tool to retrieve a list of metrics for a specific campaign. It supports flexible time-based metrics by utilizing parameters like resolution, time zone, start, and end times. The recommended version 2 provides greater flexibility with these options. This tool is ideal for analyzing campaign performance over time.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the campaign to retrieve metrics for.

parameters.name: metrics_api_version
parameters.description: Specify the version of the metrics API to use. Recommended value is '2'.

parameters.name: end_time_unix
parameters.description: Unix timestamp marking the end of the metrics period. Use only with version 2. Limited to 10 years from the start parameter.

parameters.name: metrics_item_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of item for metrics: email, webhook, twilio, slack, push, in_app. Leave empty for all types.

parameters.name: metrics_start_timestamp
parameters.description: Unix timestamp marking the start of the metrics period for version 2.

parameters.name: number_of_steps
parameters.description: (Version 1 only) The number of periods to return, with defaults and maximum limits based on the period unit (e.g., hours, days).

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Determines increment for metricshourly, daily, weekly, or monthly. Only for Version 2.

parameters.name: timezone_for_metrics
parameters.description: For version 2 only. Specify the time zone for the metrics requested. Defaults to EST if not provided. Use the region format.

parameters.name: version_1_time_unit
parameters.description: For Version 1 only, specify the time unit for the report. Options include hours, days, weeks, or months.

tools.name: GetCustomerActivities
tools.description:
Retrieve recent activities for a customer.

This tool returns a list of activities performed by or for a specified customer, such as attribute changes and message sends. It provides activity history from the past 30 days, with potential inclusion of older data.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer whose activities you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: activity_type_filter
parameters.description: Filter activities by specific type, such as 'add_relationship' or 'attribute_change'.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of `customer_id` used to reference a person (e.g., `id`, `email`, or `cio_id`). Defaults to `id` if unspecified.

parameters.name: event_or_attribute_name
parameters.description: Specify the event or attribute name to search for within activities of type `event` or `attribute_update`.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of activity results to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: start_token
parameters.description: Token to specify which page of results to return. Use the `next` property from a previous response.

tools.name: GetCustomerInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve attributes and devices for specified customers by ID.

Use this tool to get detailed attributes and devices information for up to 100 customers by their IDs. If a provided ID does not exist, it will be omitted in the response.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: GetCustomerProfileAttributes
tools.description:
Retrieve a customer's profile attributes.

This tool fetches a list of attributes for a specified customer profile. Useful for creating segments or using in message templates.

parameters.name: customer_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer to fetch their profile attributes.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of `customer_id` to reference a person. Options: 'id', 'email', 'cio_id'. Default is 'id' if not provided.

tools.name: GetCustomerSegments
tools.description:
Retrieve segments of a specific customer from Customerio.

Use this tool to get a list of segments that a specified customer profile is a part of. This can be useful for understanding customer categorization and targeting within the Customerio platform.

parameters.name: customer_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the customer for segment retrieval in Customerio.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of customer identifier to use ('id', 'email', or 'cio_id'). Default is 'id'.

tools.name: GetDeliveryMessageInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics and details for a specific message delivery.

Call this tool to get information and delivery metrics for a specific instance of a message intended for an individual recipient.

parameters.name: message_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a specific message instance to retrieve its information and metrics.

tools.name: GetExportInfo
tools.description:
Returns information about a specific export from Customerio.

Use this tool to fetch details about a particular export by providing the export ID. It retrieves comprehensive information related to the specified export.

parameters.name: export_id_to_access
parameters.description: The unique ID of the export you want to access in Customerio.

tools.name: GetImportStatus
tools.description:
Retrieve the status of an import operation.

Use this tool to get information on the status and results of a CSV file import operation, including the success of the row imports.

parameters.name: import_id
parameters.description: The ID of the import to lookup from a previously queued import operation.

tools.name: GetNewsletterLinkMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics for link clicks in a newsletter.

This tool fetches metrics for link clicks within a newsletter, providing both total counts and series data over specified periods (e.g., days, weeks). Useful for analyzing newsletter performance over time.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the newsletter to retrieve metrics for. Must be an integer.

parameters.name: include_unique_customers
parameters.description: If true, response includes only unique customer results (each customer counted once); if false, includes total click results.

parameters.name: number_of_periods
parameters.description: The number of periods to return metrics for. Defaults to maximum available, or 12 if in months. Maximums: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months.

parameters.name: time_unit_for_report
parameters.description: The unit of time for your report. Options are 'hours', 'days', 'weeks', or 'months'.

tools.name: GetNewsletterMessageMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieve delivery info for messages sent from a newsletter.

Use this tool to get information about individual message deliveries from a specific newsletter. You can specify a time range using `start_ts` and `end_ts`, otherwise, it defaults to a 6-month period from the first delivery. For longer ranges, up to 12 months of data will be returned from the most recent delivery. Timestamps indicate delivery creation, not the actual send time.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the newsletter to retrieve delivery information for.

parameters.name: begin_query_timestamp
parameters.description: The Unix timestamp marking the start of the time range for your query. Without this, data defaults to the earliest available from 6 months prior.

parameters.name: ending_timestamp_for_query
parameters.description: The ending timestamp for your query in Unix format. It specifies the end of the time range for retrieving message delivery data.

parameters.name: metrics_to_return
parameters.description: Specify one or more metrics to return, such as 'attempted', 'sent', 'delivered', etc.

parameters.name: pagination_start_token
parameters.description: The token to specify the start of the result page to return. Use the `next` value from previous responses for pagination.

parameters.name: results_per_page_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of message delivery results to retrieve per page.

tools.name: GetNewsletterMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics for a specific newsletter over time.

This tool retrieves a list of metrics for an individual newsletter over specified time intervals, such as days or weeks, presented from oldest to newest. It is useful to analyze the performance of newsletters over time, requiring at least two time steps for valid data retrieval.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the specific newsletter to retrieve metrics for. Expected to be an integer.

parameters.name: item_type_for_metrics
parameters.description: Specify the type of item to return metrics for, such as 'email', 'webhook', 'twilio', etc. If not provided, metrics for all types are returned.

parameters.name: number_of_time_periods
parameters.description: The number of time periods to return metrics for. Minimum is 2. Defaults to max: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, 121 months. Use this to specify the time span for newsletter metrics.

parameters.name: time_period_unit
parameters.description: The unit of time to report metrics (options: hours, days, weeks, months).

tools.name: GetNewsletters
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of newsletters and their metadata.

Use this tool to obtain a comprehensive list of newsletters along with detailed metadata. Ideal for managing or reviewing newsletter information.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of newsletters to retrieve per page, up to 100.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the order to sort results: `asc` for chronological, `desc` for reverse.

parameters.name: start_token
parameters.description: Token to retrieve a specific page of newsletter results. Use the `next` property from previous responses as this token.

tools.name: GetNewsletterTestGroups
tools.description:
Retrieve test group details for a specific newsletter.

Use this tool to obtain information about each test group within a specific newsletter, including content IDs for each group. Ideal for analyzing or verifying test group configurations in newsletters.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of a newsletter to retrieve its test group details.

tools.name: GetNewsletterVariantClickMetrics
tools.description:
Get link click metrics for a newsletter variant.

Retrieve metrics related to link clicks for an individual newsletter variant, such as language variations or A/B test messages. By default, the data covers up to 45 days. Specify the period and steps to customize the data range.

parameters.name: message_content_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of a specific message within a newsletter, useful for A/B tests or multilingual newsletters. Retrieve from newsletter details.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique integer identifier of a specific newsletter to retrieve click metrics.

parameters.name: item_type_for_metrics
parameters.description: The type of item to return metrics for. Options are: email, webhook, twilio, slack, push, in_app. When left empty, metrics for all types are included.

parameters.name: number_of_periods
parameters.description: Specify the number of time periods to retrieve data for. Defaults to the maximum if not specified, or 12 for months. Maximum limits: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months.

parameters.name: time_unit_for_report
parameters.description: The unit of time for generating the report. Options are: hours, days, weeks, months.

tools.name: GetNewsletterVariantInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve variant details of a specific newsletter.

Use this tool to obtain details about a specific variant of a newsletter, which could represent a language option or part of an A/B test.

parameters.name: message_identifier_in_newsletter
parameters.description: Identifier for a message within a newsletter, used for A/B tests or multi-language editions.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a newsletter. Required to retrieve specific variant information.

tools.name: GetNewsletterVariantMetrics
tools.description:
Fetch metrics for a specific newsletter variant.

This tool retrieves metrics for an individual newsletter variant, such as a language variation or A/B test version. It provides total metrics and stepped metrics over a specified time period, which are arranged chronologically. It requires at least two steps to retrieve data.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the newsletter to fetch metrics for.

parameters.name: newsletter_message_id
parameters.description: The ID of a message in a newsletter, used for identifying variants or languages within a newsletter. Useful for A/B tests or multilingual content.

parameters.name: item_type_for_metrics
parameters.description: Specify the type of item to return metrics for (e.g., email, webhook, etc.). If left empty, metrics for all types are returned.

parameters.name: number_of_period_steps
parameters.description: The number of time periods to return, requiring a minimum of 2 steps. Maximum limits apply based on the period type.

parameters.name: reporting_period_unit
parameters.description: The time unit for the report, such as 'hours', 'days', 'weeks', or 'months'. Used to define the granularity of the metrics.

tools.name: GetNewsletterVariants
tools.description:
Fetch content variants for a specified newsletter.

Use this tool to retrieve different content variants of a newsletter, useful for accessing multi-language versions or A/B test variations.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique integer identifier of a newsletter to fetch its content variants.

tools.name: GetNewsletterVariantTranslation
tools.description:
Get information on a newsletter's language variant.

Use this tool to obtain details about a particular language variant of a newsletter. Ideal for retrieving specific translations of newsletter content.

parameters.name: language_tag
parameters.description: The language tag of a newsletter variant. Leave empty for default language.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of a newsletter to retrieve its specific language variant.

tools.name: GetObjectAttributes
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of attributes for a specific object.

Use this tool to get attributes of an object, such as account name, billing date, etc., by specifying the object type and ID.

parameters.name: object_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the object, which can be either `object_id` or `cio_object_id`, depending on the id_type specified in query params.

parameters.name: object_type_identifier
parameters.description: The ID representing the object type, beginning at 1 for each new type, like 'Companies' or 'Accounts'.

parameters.name: object_id_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of ID used for the object: 'object_id' or 'cio_object_id'.

tools.name: GetObjectTypes
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of object types and their IDs.

Use this tool to obtain a list of all available object types in your system along with their incrementing IDs. This is useful when you need to query, create, or modify specific object types by their ID.

tools.name: GetPeopleByEmail
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of people matching an email address.

Use this tool to find people in your workspace based on their email address. It returns a list of individuals matching the specified email.

parameters.name: search_email_address
parameters.description: The email address to find in the workspace. Returns a list of individuals matching this email.

tools.name: GetPersonRelationships
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of objects a person is related to.

Use this tool to obtain a list of relationships associated with a specific person. It supports pagination for retrieving results in multiple pages. Note that duplicates may appear across pages.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer whose relationships you wish to retrieve.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: pagination_start_token
parameters.description: Token to specify the page of results to return. Use the `next` property's value from a previous response to get subsequent pages.

tools.name: GetRelatedPeople
tools.description:
Retrieve people related to a specified object.

Use this tool to get a list of people related to a specific object by providing the object type and object ID. Useful for exploring object relationships in Customerio.

parameters.name: object_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the object. This can be `object_id` or `cio_object_id` based on the `id_type` query parameter. Defaults to `object_id`.

parameters.name: object_type_identifier
parameters.description: The ID representing the object type, such as 'Companies' or 'Accounts'. Starts from 1 and increments for each new type.

parameters.name: identification_type
parameters.description: Specifies whether the object identifier is an `object_id` or a `cio_object_id`. Choose between these two options.

parameters.name: maximum_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve per page. Specify an integer value.

parameters.name: pagination_start_token
parameters.description: Token for starting the page of results. Use the 'next' property from a response to paginate.

tools.name: GetSegmentCustomerCount
tools.description:
Retrieve the customer count for a specific segment.

Use this tool to obtain the number of customers belonging to a particular segment identified by segment_id. This can help in analyzing segment size and its potential impact.

parameters.name: segment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the segment to retrieve the customer count. Find this ID on the segment's page or via the App API.

tools.name: GetSegmentInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information about a specific segment.

This tool retrieves detailed information about a specific segment using its segment ID. It should be called when segment information is needed for analysis or decision-making.

parameters.name: segment_identifier
parameters.description: The ID for a segment. Find this on its page in the dashboard or using the App API.

tools.name: GetSegmentMembers
tools.description:
Retrieve customer details from a specific segment.

Use this tool to get a list of customer identifiers in a specified segment. It returns identifiers for each person in the segment, providing more comprehensive information than just IDs. Useful for understanding customer segmentation.

parameters.name: segment_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a segment. Find this ID on the segment's page in the dashboard, under *Usage*.

parameters.name: maximum_results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of customer identifiers to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token to specify the start of the page of results. Use the `next` value from a previous response to paginate.

tools.name: GetSenderInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information about a specific sender by ID.

Use this tool to get detailed information for a specific sender using their ID, which is helpful for email management and verification processes.

parameters.name: sender_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a sender, required to fetch their information.

tools.name: GetSenderList
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of senders from your workspace.

This tool retrieves a list of senders in your workspace, representing the identities from which messages are sent. Use this to manage or display sender information.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of sender results to retrieve per page. Specify an integer value.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for the page of results to return. Use the `next` property from the response for pagination.

parameters.name: results_sort_order
parameters.description: Sort results: 'asc' for chronological, 'desc' for reverse chronological order.

tools.name: GetSenderUsage
tools.description:
Retrieve campaigns and newsletters using a specific sender.

Use this tool to obtain lists of campaigns and newsletters that utilize a particular sender identity. It provides insights into where a sender is actively used, helping in managing and analyzing sender strategies.

parameters.name: sender_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the sender to retrieve associated campaigns and newsletters.

tools.name: GetSubscriptionPreferences
tools.description:
Retrieve a person's subscription preferences.

Returns a list of a person's subscription preferences, including headers, topic names, and descriptions. The data is translated if a language is specified in the query.

parameters.name: customer_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the customer to retrieve subscription preferences for.

parameters.name: accept_language
parameters.description: Language tag for translating content. If not specified, defaults to the subscription center's language.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Type of customer_id used to reference a person, e.g., 'id', 'email', or 'cio_id'. Defaults to 'id'.

parameters.name: translation_language
parameters.description: Specify the language tag for translating the subscription preferences content. If not provided, the default language is used.

tools.name: GetSubscriptionTopics
tools.description:
Retrieve subscription topics from your workspace.

Use this tool to get the list of all subscription topics available in your workspace. It will return an empty array if no topics exist.

tools.name: GetTransactionalLinkMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics for clicked links in transactional messages.

This tool returns metrics for links clicked from a transactional message, including totals and metrics over specified time periods. Useful for analyzing link engagement trends over days, weeks, etc. Cannot request fewer than two periods (e.g., days or weeks).

parameters.name: transactional_message_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the transactional message, found in the UI or URL (e.g., in `/transactional/3/templates/139`, the ID is 3).

parameters.name: include_only_unique_customers
parameters.description: Return only unique customer results if true; false includes all click instances.

parameters.name: number_of_periods
parameters.description: Specify the number of periods to return metrics for. Cannot be fewer than 2 periods. Defaults to the maximum available, or 12 if the period is in months. Maximums: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months.

parameters.name: time_unit_for_report
parameters.description: The unit of time for the report. Options are: hours, days, weeks, or months.

tools.name: GetTransactionalMessage
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a transactional message.

Call this tool to get information about an individual transactional message using its ID.

parameters.name: transactional_message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the transactional message, found in the UI or URL, e.g., `/transactional/3/templates/139` has an ID of 3.

tools.name: GetTransactionalMessageDeliveries
tools.description:
Fetch delivery details for transactional messages.

Retrieve information about individual message deliveries from a transactional message. Use optional parameters to specify a time range for the message data, otherwise, data from the last 6 months is returned by default.

parameters.name: transactional_message_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the transactional message, found in the UI or URL, e.g., '/transactional/3/templates/139' where the ID is 3.

parameters.name: beginning_timestamp
parameters.description: The start time for the query, specified as a Unix timestamp. Limits the query to data starting from this time.

parameters.name: broadcast_state
parameters.description: Specifies the state of the broadcast to filter results. Options are 'failed', 'sent', 'drafted', or 'attempted'.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per page, as an integer.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Specify the token for the page of results you want to return. Use the `next` property from previous responses as the value to paginate.

parameters.name: query_ending_timestamp
parameters.description: The ending timestamp for the query, determining the end of the time range for message data retrieval.

parameters.name: return_metrics
parameters.description: Specify one or more metrics to return, such as 'sent', 'delivered', or 'clicked'.

tools.name: GetTransactionalMessageMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve metrics for a transactional message over time periods.

This tool retrieves metrics for a specified transactional message across defined time steps. It is useful for analyzing message performance over days, weeks, etc., from the oldest to the newest period.

parameters.name: transactional_message_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the transactional message. Found in the UI or URL, e.g., `/transactional/3/templates/139` means an ID of 3.

parameters.name: number_of_periods
parameters.description: The number of periods to retrieve metrics for. Defaults to the maximum available, or 12 if the period is in months. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months. Days start at 00:00 EST. Weeks start at 00:00 EST on Sunday. Months start at 00:00 EST on the 1st of the month.

parameters.name: time_unit_for_report
parameters.description: Specify the unit of time for the report, such as 'hours', 'days', 'weeks', or 'months'.

tools.name: GetTransactionalMessageVariants
tools.description:
Retrieve content variants of a transactional message.

This tool is used to obtain the different language variants of a transactional message's content. It should be called when you need to access the available language or format options for a specific message.

parameters.name: transactional_message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the transactional message, found in the UI or URL, e.g., `/transactional/3/templates/139` means ID is 3.

tools.name: GetTransactionalVariant
tools.description:
Fetch translation details of a transactional message.

Use this tool to obtain details about a translation of a specific transactional message, including its content. It's useful when you need to access different language variants of transactional messages.

parameters.name: language_tag
parameters.description: Specify the language tag for the message variant. Use an empty string for the default language. If the variant does not exist, an error is returned.

parameters.name: transactional_message_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the transactional message, found in the UI or URL, e.g., `/transactional/3/templates/139` has an ID of 3.

tools.name: GetWebhookInfo
tools.description:
Get detailed information about a specific webhook.

This tool retrieves information about a specific reporting webhook from Customerio. It should be called when you need details about a particular webhook identified by its webhook ID.

parameters.name: webhook_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the webhook you want to retrieve information for. This should be an integer.

tools.name: ListBroadcasts
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of API-triggered broadcasts with metadata.

Use this tool to get detailed information on all your API-triggered broadcasts, including their metadata. Ideal for keeping track of broadcast activities or managing campaigns.

tools.name: ListCampaignActions
tools.description:
Retrieve operations in a campaign workflow.

This tool retrieves the actions or 'tiles' in a campaign workflow, returning up to 10 actions per call. If more pages of results are available, a 'next' string is included, which can be used to access subsequent pages. Ideal for analyzing or modifying campaign workflows.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to retrieve workflow information for. Must be an integer.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token for the results page to return. Use 'next' from the response as this value for subsequent pages.

tools.name: ListCollections
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of all collections including names and schemas.

Use this tool to obtain all existing collections, providing both their names and schemas. Useful for managing database structures or viewing collection configurations.

tools.name: ListExports
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of exports for people or campaign metrics.

This tool is used to obtain a list of exports, which are point-in-time records of people or campaign metrics. Call this tool when you need detailed information about exports from Customerio.

tools.name: ListRecentActivities
tools.description:
Retrieve recent activity logs from the past 30 days.

This tool calls the Customerio API to obtain a list of recent activities for people. It returns activity history within the past 30 days, similar to workspace's Activity Logs, and might include older activities.

parameters.name: activity_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of activity to search for. Use specific activity types or patterns like `_o:<object_type_id>` for objects and `_r:<object_type_id>` for relationships.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of `customer_id` to reference a person. Options are `id`, `email`, or `cio_id`. Default is `id`.

parameters.name: event_or_attribute_name
parameters.description: The name of the event or attribute to return in the activity logs.

parameters.name: include_deleted_people
parameters.description: If true, return results for deleted people in the list of activities.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token to specify the page of results to return. Use the `next` property from the previous response.

parameters.name: person_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the person to look up, which can be their `id`, `email`, or `cio_id`. Prefix with `cio_` for `cio_id`.

parameters.name: results_per_page_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of activity results to retrieve per page.

tools.name: ListReportingWebhooks
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of reporting webhooks.

Use this tool to get a list of all reporting webhooks configured in your Customerio account. It should be called when you need to access or manage existing reporting webhooks.

tools.name: ListSnippetsWorkspace
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of reusable content snippets from your workspace.

Use this tool to obtain snippets, such as common footers, which are reusable content pieces in your workspace.

tools.name: ListTransactionalMessages
tools.description:
Retrieve your list of transactional message IDs.

This tool retrieves a list of your transactional message IDs used for triggering individual deliveries. It does not include delivery instances themselves.

tools.name: ListWorkspaces
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of workspaces in your account.

Use this tool to get information about all workspaces available in your Customerio account. It provides a list that can be used to view or manage workspaces.

tools.name: RemoveEmailSuppression
tools.description:
Remove an email address from the suppression list.

Use this tool to remove a specific email address from the email service provider's suppression list, allowing future communications to be sent to it.

parameters.name: email_address_to_remove
parameters.description: The email address to remove from the suppression list, allowing future communications.

parameters.name: suppression_reason
parameters.description: The reason the email address was suppressed (e.g., 'bounces', 'spam_reports').

tools.name: RemoveUnusedSnippet
tools.description:
Removes an unused snippet from the system.

This tool removes a snippet that is not in use. If the snippet is currently in use, an error will be returned.

parameters.name: snippet_name
parameters.description: The name of the snippet to be removed. Must be unused to avoid errors.

tools.name: ReplaceCollectionContents
tools.description:
Replace the entire contents of a data collection.

    Use this tool to completely replace the existing contents of a data collection by specifying the new keys and values. Ideal for cases where a full update is required. Keep in mind the size limitations: collections must not exceed 10 MB and no single row more than 10 KB.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: collection_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the collection whose contents are being replaced. This is required for identifying the specific collection to update.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: RetrieveCollectionContents
tools.description:
Retrieve contents of a specified collection.

Use this tool to fetch the data stored in a specific collection on the Customerio platform. It returns each row as a JSON object, ideal for accessing stored information quickly.

parameters.name: collection_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the collection to retrieve contents from.

tools.name: RetrieveCollectionDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details about a specific collection.

This tool retrieves information about a collection, including its schema and name, without including the content of the collection. It should be used when you need information about the structure and title of a collection.

parameters.name: collection_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a specific collection to retrieve its details.

tools.name: RetrieveCustomerMessages
tools.description:
Retrieve deliveries sent to a customer within a time range.

Use parameters to specify the time range for the messages you want to retrieve. If no time range is provided, it defaults to the most recent 6 months. The tool returns data on when deliveries were created, which may differ from when they were sent.

parameters.name: customer_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the customer whose message deliveries you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of customer_id used to reference a person. Options: 'id', 'email', 'cio_id'. Defaults to 'id' if not provided.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve per page. This limits the number of messages returned in a single response.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for the page of results to return. Use the `next` property from previous responses to get the next page.

parameters.name: query_end_timestamp
parameters.description: The ending timestamp (in integer format) for the query to limit data retrieval to specific time ranges.

parameters.name: starting_timestamp
parameters.description: The beginning timestamp for the query in integer format, used to filter messages by start date.

tools.name: RetrieveNewsletterLanguageVariant
tools.description:
Get info on a newsletter's language variant in A/B test.

Use this tool to obtain details about a specific language variant of a newsletter that is part of an A/B test. It requires the newsletter ID, test group ID, and language code.

parameters.name: ab_test_group_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the A/B test group for retrieving the language variant.

parameters.name: language_tag
parameters.description: Specify the language tag of the newsletter variant. Use an empty string to default to your primary language.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier of the newsletter to retrieve its language variant details.

tools.name: RetrieveNewsletterMetadata
tools.description:

Call this tool to get detailed information about a specific newsletter using its ID.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the newsletter to retrieve metadata.

tools.name: SendTransactionalEmail
tools.description:
Send a customizable transactional email.

Use this tool to send a transactional email using Customerio. You can utilize a `transactional_message_id` to specify a template or customize the email by providing `body`, `subject`, and `from` values. If a metrics association is needed, include the `transactional_message_id`. It's designed for sending personalized messages while tracking delivery metrics effectively.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"transactional_message_id": "12345", "recipient": "example@domain.com", "body": "Hello, this is a test email.", "subject": "Test Email", "from": "no-reply@domain.com"}

tools.name: UploadCsvToCustomerio
tools.description:
Upload a CSV file to Customerio for bulk data processing.

Use this tool to upload a CSV file containing people, events, objects, or relationships to Customerio. The CSV must be hosted at a short-lived public URL, ideally expiring 2 hours after the upload. The endpoint performs basic validations and queues the import for processing, which occurs in multiple stages. You will receive a confirmation and a URL to check the import status. Any errors or warnings during the import can be accessed through downloadable CSV reports available via the export endpoints.

the stringified JSON input object for execution.

summary:
**Customer.io API Toolkit** provides a set of tools that enable easy interaction with the Customer.io App API, enhancing marketing automation workflows.

**Capabilities:**
- Create, manage, and delete segments, collections, and newsletters.
- Fetch detailed delivery and performance metrics for campaigns and transactional messages.
- Manage customer data with CRUD operations on customer attributes and activities.
- Retrieve insights on message performance, including link metrics and suppression statuses.

**Secrets:**
- Use the `CUSTOMERIO_API_KEY` to authenticate API requests, ensuring secure access to your Customer.io resources.
